intro: Scleria macrogyne, commonly known as the broad-leaved sedges, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its tall, cylindrical stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Its inflorescence consists of a spike-like cluster of small, three-lobed flowers. Scleria macrogyne is often found in wetlands and along waterways, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
